name: medic
description: SMS data collection designed for rural environments.
long_description: Medic Mobile is a web based SMS data collection and analytics tool focused on community health care workers in rural environments. We help large health organizations collect and analyze data sent from health care workers using ordinary mobile phones.

locale.title: Locale
locale.description: Default tries to use best option according to browser settings, you can override that here.

locales.title: Locales
locales.description: A list of available locales with a unique short code (egs: 'en', 'fr') and a human readable name of the locale (egs: 'English', 'French')

locale.title: Default Locale For Website
locale.description: The code of the default locale for users logging in to the website. Can be overridden in user settings. Must be one of the codes specified in Locales above.

locale_outgoing.title: Default Locale For Outgoing Messages
locale_outgoing.description: The code of the default locale for outgoing messages. Must be one of the codes specified in Locales above.

reported_date_format.title: DateTime Format
reported_date_format.description: Format used to display dates and times.

start_date.title: Start Date
start_date.description: Auto-replies are added to messages received after this date.  If left empty auto-replies are not added.  Use the format YYYY-MM-DD to define the date, for example 2014-03-27.  This setting only applies to unstructured messages, not forms.  Error replies are added when a message is empty or a form is not found and we are in forms only mode.  Otherwise you will get a default reply. All reply messages are generated based on translation and locale settings.

district_admins_access_unallocated_messa.title: Allow District Admins To View Unallocated Messages
district_admins_access_unallocated_messa.description: If ticked, district administrators will be able to view messages with no allocated facility as well as messages from their district.

default_country_code.title: Default Country Code
default_country_code.description: Messages without a country code will be assigned this country code.

replace.title: Replace with
replace.description: The value to replace the match with

outgoing_phone_filters.title: Outgoing Phone Filters
outgoing_phone_filters.description: These filters are applied to every phone number on an outgoing message.  This can be useful if your incoming phone number and outgoing phone number formats are slightly different.

match.title: Match
match.description: A regular expression used to match a phone number.  e.g. \+997

replace.title: Replace with
replace.description: Replace the match with this value.

schedule_morning_hours.title: Scheduled Message Morning Hours
schedule_morning_hours.description: Only send messages on or after this hour.

schedule_morning_minutes.title: Scheduled Message Morning Minutes
schedule_morning_minutes.description: Only send messages on or after this minute.

schedule_evening_hours.title: Scheduled Message Evening Hours
schedule_evening_hours.description: Only send messages on or before this hour.

schedule_evening_minutes.title: Scheduled Message Evening Minutes
schedule_evening_minutes.description: Only send messages on or before this minute.

synthetic_date.title: Synthetic date
synthetic_date.description: Only use this if you are testing message scheduling and want to simulate a specific date. e.g. 201304121200

id_format.title: Patient ID Format
id_format.description: Length of generated numerical identifiers. Note, an extra check digit is always used, so the default value (1111) generates a length of 5.

contact_display_short.title: Short Contact Display
contact_display_short.description: How to render the contact name in short format? e.g. clinic.name, clinic.contact.name, clinic.parent.name

statistics_submission.title: Anonymous Statistics Submission
statistics_submission.description: Whether and how to submit anonymous statistics. Valid values: 'none', 'web'

kujua-reporting.title: Scheduled Reports
kujua-reporting.description: The forms to include in reporting rates stats.

condition.title: Condition To Send Alerts
condition.description: Alert will be sent when condition is true. Build condition using the notation `form_code(reports_ago).field_id`. E.g.: The following can be used to send an alert if the value of `s1_avail` in form `STCK` falls below the three month average of `s1_used`: "STCK(0).s1_avail < (STCK(0).s1_used + STCK(1).s1_used + STCK(2).s1_used ) / 3".

message.title: Alert Text
message.description: Text that will be sent out in the alert. Variables names can be used. E.g.: {{clinic.name}}, {{s1_name}}.

recipient.title: Send Alerts To
recipient.description: The email or phone number to receive alerts. Can also use variable name to receive alert. E.g.: reporting_unit, parent, grandparent, name@ngo.org, +15559870000

form.title: Reminder Form Code
form.description: What form is this reminder for?  e.g. ZDIS

text_expression.title: Reminder Text Configuration
text_expression.description: A text expression definition of the schedule.  See http://bunkat.github.io/later/parsers.html#text e.g. at 9am on Monday

cron.title: Reminder Cron Configuration
cron.description: A cron definition of the schedule. Optional, a text expression will override this.  e.g. weekly on Monday at 9am: '0 9 * * 1'

mute_after_form_for.title: Mute Reminders For
mute_after_form_for.description: After receiving a form, how long to mute reminders for.  Supported units: years, months, weeks, days, hours, minutes. e.g. 5 days

message.title: Reminder Text
message.description: Message to be sent.  The following strings will be substituted into the message: {{week}}, {{year}} and {{form}}.

form.title: Registration Form
form.description: Form code of a registration form. e.g. ANCR

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Available field names for use in validations

help.title: Help
help.description: Instructions explaining how to use this form, including description and form submission examples in Markdown format.
help.default:
Register for this message workflow by sending an SMS with the following format: `ANCR <patientname>`.

For example, to register "Maria Soleil" you would send: `ANCR Maria Soleil`

trigger.title: Trigger
trigger.description: When form is received trigger actions like enrolling in schedule.

params.title: Parameters
params.description: i.e. if assigning a schedule provide the name.

bool_expr.title: Boolean expression
bool_expr.description: If this expression evaluates to false the trigger will be skipped.

join_responses.title: Join Validation Responses
join_responses.description: By default we send one validation response at a time.  Use this option to join or concatenate all validation response messages in one.  Note, like all outgoing messages it will be truncated at 160 characters.

property.title: Property
property.description: The property on the JSON form to validate.

rule.title: Validation Rule
rule.description: The validation rule. Backslashes must be double escaped.

message.title: Response Message
message.description: The response when validation fails. Mustache templating is supported.

content.title: Message Content
content.default: '{{patient_name}}' is not a valid patient name. Please submit a patient name between 5 and 50 characters.

locale.title: Locale
locale.description: Set the locale if you need to support responses in multiple languages.

locale.title: Locale
locale.description: Set the locale if you need to support responses in multiple languages.

recipient.title: Recipient
recipient.description: Contact to recieve the message. Use a field name on registration form or one of the following to reference the facility: reporting_unit, parent, grandparent.

form.title: Report Form
form.description: Form code of the report. e.g. ANCV

silence_type.title: Schedule Name
silence_type.description: Name of reminder schedule(s) to clear after receiving this report.  Name needs to match exactly, e.g. ANC Reminders.  If you need to support clearing multiple schedules then separate the names with commas.

silence_for.title: Silence Window
silence_for.description: The length of time used to find the next reminder group to clear.  Leave blank to clear all reminder groups.  Supported units: years, months, weeks, days, hours, minutes. e.g. 25 days

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Available field names for use in validations

join_responses.title: Join Validation Responses
join_responses.description: By default we send one validation response at a time.  Use this option to join or concatenate all validation response messages in one.  Note, like all outgoing messages it will be truncated at 160 characters.

property.title: Property
property.description: The property on the JSON form to validate.

rule.title: Validation Rule
rule.description: The validation rule. Backslashes must be double escaped.

message.title: Response Message
message.description: The response when validation fails. Mustache templating is supported.

recipient.title: Recipient
recipient.description: Contact to recieve the message. Use a field name on registration form or one of the following to reference the facility: reporting_unit, parent, grandparent.

name.title: Name
name.description: A unique name to define this schedule. e.g. ANC Reminders

summary.title: Summary
summary.description: A brief summary of this schedule

description.title: Description
description.description: A complete description of this schedule in markdown format

start_from.title: Timestamp Property Name
start_from.description: A timestamp or date property on the record that is used to calculate when messages are sent. e.g. lmp_date.  Use reported_date if you want to reference the date and time the report was received.

locale.title: Locale
locale.description: Set the locale if you need to support responses in multiple languages.

group.title: Message Group Number
group.description: You can group reminders together by assigning a group number so they can be cleared in batches.

offset.title: Send Message After
offset.description: This value is added to the timestamp property value to determine when to send the message.  Supported units: years, months, weeks, days, hours, minutes. e.g. 5 days

send_day.title: Send Day
send_day.description: Optionally specify the nearest day to offset.

send_time.title: Send Time
send_time.description: Specify time of day at which the message is to be sent. Ignored if blank. If timezone offset is not specfiied GMT will be used.  e.g. 20:30 +0300

recipient.title: Recipient
recipient.description: Contact to recieve the message. Use a field name on registration form or one of the following to reference the facility: reporting_unit, parent, grandparent.

off_form.title: Stop Notifications Form
off_form.description: When receiving a form of this type, stop sending notifications

on_form.title: Resume Notifications Form
on_form.description: When receiving a form of this type, resume sending notifications

confirm_deactivation.title: Confirm Muting Notifications?
confirm_deactivation.description: Disable stopping of notification based on reports, requires administrator action.

join_responses.title: Join Validation Responses
join_responses.description: By default we send one validation response at a time.  Use this option to join or concatenate all validation response messages in one.  Note, like all outgoing messages it will be truncated at 160 characters.

property.title: Property
property.description: The property on the JSON form to validate.

rule.title: Validation Rule
rule.description: The validation rule. Backslashes must be double escaped.

locale.description: Set the locale if you need to support responses in multiple languages.

default.default:
Terms

A query is broken up into terms and operators. There are two types of terms: Single Terms and Phrases. A Single Term is a single word such as "test" or "hello". A Phrase is a group of words surrounded by double quotes such as "hello dolly". Multiple terms can be combined together with Boolean operators to form a more complex query.

When performing a search you can either specify a field by typing a field name followed by a colon ":" and then the term you are looking for, or use the default fields. The default fields are: patient_id, patient_name, caregiver_name and caregiver_phone, so if you do not specify a field name these will be used. If you would like the default search fields to change please send in a support request.

Fields

When performing a search you can either specify a field, or use the default field.

You can search any field by typing the field name followed by a colon ":" and then the term you are looking for.

As an example, let's assume a Lucene index contains two fields, title and text and text is the default field. If you want to find the document entitled "The Right Way" which contains the text "don't go this way", you can enter:

title:"The Right Way" AND text:go

or

title:"Do it right" AND right

Since text is the default field, the field indicator is not required.

Note: The field is only valid for the term that it directly precedes, so the query

title:Do it right

Will only find "Do" in the title field. It will find "it" and "right" in the default field (in this case the text field).

You can search any field by typing the field name followed by a colon ":" and then the term you are looking for.

Wildcard Searches

Lucene supports single and multiple character wildcard searches within single terms (not within phrase queries).

To perform a single character wildcard search use the "?" symbol.

To perform a multiple character wildcard search use the "*" symbol.

The single character wildcard search looks for terms that match that with the single character replaced. For example, to search for "text" or "test" you can use the search:

te?t

Multiple character wildcard searches looks for 0 or more characters. For example, to search for test, tests or tester, you can use the search:

test*

You can also use the wildcard searches in the middle of a term.

te*t

Note: You cannot use a * or ? symbol as the first character of a search.

Range Searches

Range Queries allow one to match documents whose field(s) values are between the lower and upper bound specified by the Range Query. Range Queries can be inclusive or exclusive of the upper and lower bounds. Sorting is done lexicographically.

title:{Aida TO Carmen}

This will find all documents whose titles are between Aida and Carmen, but not including Aida and Carmen.

Inclusive range queries are denoted by square brackets. Exclusive range queries are denoted by curly brackets.

Date Range Searches

When searching dates you need to include a strict syntax:

reported_date<date>:[2002-01-01 TO 2003-01-01]

This will find documents whose reported_date fields have values between 2002-01-01 and 2003-01-01, inclusive.

Integer Range Searches

When searching integers you need to include a strict syntax:

last_menstrual_period<int>:[10 TO 12]

This will find documents whose last_menstrual_period fields have values between 10 and 12, inclusive.

Boolean Operators

Boolean operators allow terms to be combined through logic operators. Lucene supports AND, "+", OR, NOT and "-" as Boolean operators(Note: Boolean operators must be ALL CAPS).

The OR operator is the default conjunction operator. This means that if there is no Boolean operator between two terms, the OR operator is used. The OR operator links two terms and finds a matching document if either of the terms exist in a document. The symbol || can be used in place of the word OR.

To search for documents that contain either "jakarta apache" or just "jakarta" use the query:

"jakarta apache" jakarta

or

"jakarta apache" OR jakarta
AND

The AND operator matches documents where both terms exist anywhere in the text of a single document. This is equivalent to an intersection using sets. The symbol && can be used in place of the word AND.

To search for documents that contain "jakarta apache" and "Apache Lucene" use the query: 

"jakarta apache" AND "Apache Lucene"
+

The "+" or required operator requires that the term after the "+" symbol exist somewhere in the field of a single document.

To search for documents that must contain "jakarta" and may contain "lucene" use the query:

+jakarta lucene
NOT

The NOT operator excludes documents that contain the term after NOT. This is equivalent to a difference using sets. The symbol ! can be used in place of the word NOT.

To search for documents that contain "jakarta apache" but not "Apache Lucene" use the query: 

"jakarta apache" NOT "Apache Lucene"

Note: The NOT operator cannot be used with just one term. For example, the following search will return no results:

NOT "jakarta apache"
-

The "-" or prohibit operator excludes documents that contain the term after the "-" symbol.

To search for documents that contain "jakarta apache" but not "Apache Lucene" use the query: 

"jakarta apache" -"Apache Lucene"

translations.content:
Terms

A query is broken up into terms and operators. There are two types of terms: Single Terms and Phrases. A Single Term is a single word such as "test" or "hello". A Phrase is a group of words surrounded by double quotes such as "hello dolly". Multiple terms can be combined together with Boolean operators to form a more complex query.

When performing a search you can either specify a field by typing a field name followed by a colon ":" and then the term you are looking for, or use the default fields. The default fields are: patient_id, patient_name, caregiver_name and caregiver_phone, so if you do not specify a field name these will be used. If you would like the default search fields to change please send in a support request.

Fields

When performing a search you can either specify a field, or use the default field.

You can search any field by typing the field name followed by a colon ":" and then the term you are looking for.

As an example, let's assume a Lucene index contains two fields, title and text and text is the default field. If you want to find the document entitled "The Right Way" which contains the text "don't go this way", you can enter:

title:"The Right Way" AND text:go

or

title:"Do it right" AND right

Since text is the default field, the field indicator is not required.

Note: The field is only valid for the term that it directly precedes, so the query

title:Do it right

Will only find "Do" in the title field. It will find "it" and "right" in the default field (in this case the text field).

You can search any field by typing the field name followed by a colon ":" and then the term you are looking for.

Wildcard Searches

Lucene supports single and multiple character wildcard searches within single terms (not within phrase queries).

To perform a single character wildcard search use the "?" symbol.

To perform a multiple character wildcard search use the "*" symbol.

The single character wildcard search looks for terms that match that with the single character replaced. For example, to search for "text" or "test" you can use the search:

te?t

Multiple character wildcard searches looks for 0 or more characters. For example, to search for test, tests or tester, you can use the search:

test*

You can also use the wildcard searches in the middle of a term.

te*t

Note: You cannot use a * or ? symbol as the first character of a search.

Range Searches

Range Queries allow one to match documents whose field(s) values are between the lower and upper bound specified by the Range Query. Range Queries can be inclusive or exclusive of the upper and lower bounds. Sorting is done lexicographically.

title:{Aida TO Carmen}

This will find all documents whose titles are between Aida and Carmen, but not including Aida and Carmen.

Inclusive range queries are denoted by square brackets. Exclusive range queries are denoted by curly brackets.

Date Range Searches

When searching dates you need to include a strict syntax:

reported_date<date>:[2002-01-01 TO 2003-01-01]

This will find documents whose reported_date fields have values between 2002-01-01 and 2003-01-01, inclusive.

Integer Range Searches

When searching integers you need to include a strict syntax:

last_menstrual_period<int>:[10 TO 12]

This will find documents whose last_menstrual_period fields have values between 10 and 12, inclusive.

Boolean Operators

Boolean operators allow terms to be combined through logic operators. Lucene supports AND, "+", OR, NOT and "-" as Boolean operators(Note: Boolean operators must be ALL CAPS).

The OR operator is the default conjunction operator. This means that if there is no Boolean operator between two terms, the OR operator is used. The OR operator links two terms and finds a matching document if either of the terms exist in a document. The symbol || can be used in place of the word OR.

To search for documents that contain either "jakarta apache" or just "jakarta" use the query:

"jakarta apache" jakarta

or

"jakarta apache" OR jakarta
AND

The AND operator matches documents where both terms exist anywhere in the text of a single document. This is equivalent to an intersection using sets. The symbol && can be used in place of the word AND.

To search for documents that contain "jakarta apache" and "Apache Lucene" use the query: 

"jakarta apache" AND "Apache Lucene"
+

The "+" or required operator requires that the term after the "+" symbol exist somewhere in the field of a single document.

To search for documents that must contain "jakarta" and may contain "lucene" use the query:

+jakarta lucene
NOT

The NOT operator excludes documents that contain the term after NOT. This is equivalent to a difference using sets. The symbol ! can be used in place of the word NOT.

To search for documents that contain "jakarta apache" but not "Apache Lucene" use the query: 

"jakarta apache" NOT "Apache Lucene"

Note: The NOT operator cannot be used with just one term. For example, the following search will return no results:

NOT "jakarta apache"
-

The "-" or prohibit operator excludes documents that contain the term after the "-" symbol.

To search for documents that contain "jakarta apache" but not "Apache Lucene" use the query: 

"jakarta apache" -"Apache Lucene"

default.default:
Rules

Validation rules are code fragments used to determine if some input is valid. For example, to say a field is only valid if the value has at least five characters, you would use the lenMin(5).

Operators

The available operators are:

&&
and
||
or
!
not
a ? b : c
ternary, ie: if 'a' is true, then check 'b', otherwise check 'c'
()
nested blocks, eg: 'a && (b || c)'

Functions

The available operators are:

equals
Comparison
iEquals
Case insensitive comparison
sEquals
Type sensitive equals
siEquals
Type sensitive case insensitive equals
lenMin
Minimum length
lenMax
Maximum length
lenEquals
Exact length
min
Minimum value
max
Maximum value
between
Minimum and maximum value
in
One of the provided values
required
Must have a value
optional
Always valid
numeric
Numbers only
integer
Integer numbers only
alpha
Letters only
alphaNumeric
Numbers and letters only
email
Email address format
regex
A custom regular expression
unique
Used to specify one or more fields which must be unique, eg: "unique('patient_id', 'lmp')". To check uniqueness within a form type, include 'form' as a parameter, eg: "unique('patient_id','form')".
uniqueWithin
Used to specify one or more fields which must be unique within a given time frame, eg: "uniqueWithin('patient_id', 'name', '1 months')"
exists
Validates that the provided value matches an existing document, eg: "exists('ANCR', 'patient_id')"

uniqueWithin
Used to specify one or more fields which must be unique within a given time frame, eg: "uniqueWithin('patient_id', 'name', '1 months')"
exists
Validates that the provided value matches an existing document, eg: "exists('ANCR', 'patient_id')"

default.default:
Configuration

Outgoing messages can be configured to include data from the document by wrapping the field name in braces, eg:

Thank you \{\{contact.name\}\}, \{\{patient_name\}\} has been registered.

More information.

Available Fields

contact
The contact at the clinic. Use contact.name or contact.phone.
clinic
The clinic
parent
The parent facility of the clinic
grandparent
The grandparent facility of the clinic
health_center
The health center
district
The district
All other fields on the document are included

Formatters

To format dates using the configured date format:

Expected due date is \{\{#date\}\}\{\{expected_date\}\}\{\{/date\}\}

Or the configured datetime format:

Message received at \{\{#datetime\}\}\{\{reported_date\}\}\{\{/datetime\}\}

default.default:
You can export data by making requests to specific URLs.

Forms

Export a file containing all submitted forms.

/api/v1/export/forms/{formcode}

Parameters:

format
The format of the returned file, either 'csv' or 'xml'. Defaults to 'csv'.
locale
Locale for translatable data. Defaults to 'en'.
tz
The timezone to show date values in, as an offset in minutes from GMT, for example '-120'.
skip_header_row
'true' to omit the column headings. Defaults to 'false'.
columns

An orderered array of columns to export, eg:

["reported_date","from","related_entities.clinic.name"]

Defaults to:

["_id","patient_id","reported_date", "from", "related_entities.clinic.contact.name", "related_entities.clinic.name", "related_entities.clinic.parent.contact.name", "related_entities.clinic.parent.name", "related_entities.clinic.parent.parent.name"]

Available columns:

  • _id
  • patient_id
  • reported_date
  • from
  • related_entities.clinic.name
  • related_entities.clinic.external_id
  • related_entities.clinic.contact.name
  • related_entities.clinic.parent.name
  • related_entities.clinic.parent.external_id
  • related_entities.clinic.parent.contact.name
  • related_entities.clinic.parent.parent.name
  • related_entities.clinic.parent.parent.external_id

All form fields will be included as columns at the end regardless of the value for this parameter.

Messages

Export a file containing all messages

/api/v1/export/messages

Examples:

Return only rows that are scheduled to be sent in the next ten days.

/export/messages?filter_state=scheduled&filter_state_to=10

Parameters:

format
The format of the returned file, either 'csv' or 'xml'. Defaults to 'csv'.
locale
Locale for translatable data. Defaults to 'en'.
tz
The timezone to show date values in, as an offset in minutes from GMT, for example '-120'.
skip_header_row
'true' to omit the column headings. Defaults to 'false'.
columns

An orderered array of columns to export, eg:

["reported_date","from","related_entities.clinic.name"]

Defaults to:

["_id","patient_id","reported_date", "from", "related_entities.clinic.contact.name", "related_entities.clinic.name", "related_entities.clinic.parent.contact.name", "related_entities.clinic.parent.name", "related_entities.clinic.parent.parent.name","task.type","task.state","received","scheduled","pending","sent","cleared","muted"]

Available columns:

  • _id
  • patient_id
  • reported_date
  • from
  • related_entities.clinic.name
  • related_entities.clinic.external_id
  • related_entities.clinic.contact.name
  • related_entities.clinic.parent.name
  • related_entities.clinic.parent.external_id
  • related_entities.clinic.parent.contact.name
  • related_entities.clinic.parent.parent.name
  • related_entities.clinic.parent.parent.external_id
  • task.type
  • task.state
  • received
  • scheduled
  • pending
  • sent
  • cleared
  • muted

Regardless of the value for this parameter, for each message the following four columns will be appended

  • Message UUID
  • Sent By
  • To phone
  • Message Body
filter_state
Used in conjunction with the parameters below to only return messages that were in a given state. Possible values are 'received', 'scheduled', 'pending', 'sent', 'cleared', or 'muted'.
filter_state_from
The number of days from now to use as a lower bound on the date that the message is in the given state. Defaults to no lower bound. Ignored if filter_state is not provided.
filter_state_to
The number of days from now to use as an upper bound on the date that the message is in the given state. Defaults to no upper bound. Ignored if filter_state is not provided.

Audit Log

Export a file containing the audit log.

/api/v1/export/audit

Parameters:

format
The format of the returned file, either 'csv' or 'xml'. Defaults to 'csv'.
locale
Locale for translatable data. Defaults to 'en'.
tz
The timezone to show date values in, as an offset in minutes from GMT, for example '-120'.
skip_header_row
'true' to omit the column headings. Defaults to 'false'.

User Feedback

Export a file containing the user feedback.

/api/v1/export/feedback

Parameters:

format
The format of the returned file, either 'csv' or 'xml'. Defaults to 'csv'.
locale
Locale for translatable data. Defaults to 'en'.
tz
The timezone to show date values in, as an offset in minutes from GMT, for example '-120'.
skip_header_row
'true' to omit the column headings. Defaults to 'false'.
